definitions.definition: to make known or show something that is surprising or that was previously secret:
examples: He was jailed for revealing secrets to the Russians.

definitions.definition: to allow something to be seen that, until then, had been hidden:
examples: A gap in the clouds revealed the Atlantic far below.

definitions.definition: an occasion at the end of a television programme, etc. when something that has been hidden or kept secret until then is shown to the audience:
examples: The final reveal of the new kitchen was a huge success.
